name: Useful IT notes for Physical Oceanographers
tagline: Found out how to do something cool or useful? Share it here :)
body:
## Welcome to the Physical Oceanography Repository

I've set up a github repository with some useful setup files. I hope these are useful and straight forward. You can download the whole folder using the links at the top of the page or follow the links below to individual files.

### Main features of the repo:
***
* New to the unix systems? Take a look at [examplte_.cshrc](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/example_.cshrc) and [example_.login](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/example_.login) .
* Fed up of csh? Take a look at [bash](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/bash)
* Kick that matlab habit? This is how to set up [Python](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/Anaconda)
and [Ipython notebooks](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/Ipythonnotebooks)
* How am I putting this all up here? Git! Set it up for yourself [here](https://github.com/hlburns/ITintro/blob/master/Git)

***

### Authors and Contributors
I hope as you come across things you add them to this repository to share info across the research group. For more info please check out @hlburns github page.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
